lines.text:
[Meeting Bruce and Henry after Henry's recovery]
Hi, Henry! I'm Rudy!
[Leans close to Henry's face]
Rooooo-deeee!
[Leaves]
What's wrong with him?
He's an asshole.
Oh.
Hey, Hank what are you doin?
Paintin', crackers
I know, but you're not packed, why aren't you packed?
Cause I'm not goin'
Remember when we talked about this last week? Your family coming to come take you home?
Yeah, but I changed my mind, I'm gonna stay
Your family is coming to pick you up, you're going home.
But, I live here.
No, man this is a pit stop. I hear you got a beautiful place man and your family is gonna be there.
But you're not gonna be there.
No, I gotta hang here.
But I don't know them.
They'll be there for you, they're gonna take care of you.
Well I don't want them to take care of me Bradley! I don't! No!
Hank, come on man
Leave me alone, Bradley
Hank you're gonna be just fine, ok?
I just can't remember.
[Henry flicks a wad of paper at Rachel in the library]

[whispers]
Dad, stop it!
[He flicks another wad of paper at her]

[whispers sternly]
Dad, I'm serious!
I know. Very.
I can read! I can read! Ajax! This is Ajax!

[recurring line]
I gotta get me some of that.
I remember grey carpet. I wanna go home.
That woman is hot.
I know. You gotta get you some of that.
My brother was married. One day he came home, found out she was cheating.
Cheating?
Doin' the serious with another man.
Oh, no.
Oh, yeah.
What's wrong, Mr. Turner?
I had enough, so I said when.
Good for you.
That table in my dining room is not the table I ordered. That table looks like a... Goddamn turtle. I demand the table I ordered within the next few days.
You see that man over there? That lady over there. He used to be her husband. Who's she kidding? The damage has already been done.
[Everyone laughs at Henry's joke]
You see that man over there? That lady over there. He used to be her husband. Who's she kidding? The damage has already been done.
[Sarah and the old man laugh]
I know a good blowfish restaurant
[comforting his daughter on her first day of boarding school]

One of the things I do remember is my first day at school. There were all these weird-looking kids and I didn't know any of them and they didn't know me. I was scared, but after two days, we were all laughing about how scared we were. Everybody feels like you do, honey. Everybody.
[emboldened, Henry's daughter goes off with the rest of her class]
That's sweet, I didn't know you remembered that.
I don't.
No thanks, I don't like eggs.
What?
Eggs are your favourite!
Okay, then give me lots of eggs.
Hey Hank, whatcha doin'?
Paintin'. Crackers.
